heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 24 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 300 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 4.9°C), cloud levels (up 465 m), dew point temperature (up 3.6°C), and outside temperature (up 4.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 299.7m lower than yesterday, 100.4m lower than the past week, 465.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 794m to a maximum of 2000m, averaging 897.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 997.9m and 1362.8m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and little or no wind. Showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
